intro: Trachystemon creticus, commonly known as the Cretan spurge, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It is part of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its latex-producing species. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered plant in its native range.
